name: Key
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Key
description:
Key

Every Datastore record has an identifying key, which includes the record’s entity kind and a unique identifier. The identifier may be either a key name string, assigned explicitly by the application, or an integer numeric ID, assigned automatically by Datastore.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new(
  project: "my-todo-project",
  keyfile: "/path/to/keyfile.json"
)

task = datastore.find "Task", "sampleTask"
task.key.project #=> "my-todo-project"

require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new(
  project: "my-todo-project",
  keyfile: "/path/to/keyfile.json"
)

task = datastore.find "Task", "sampleTask"
task.key.project #=> "my-todo-project"

require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new(
  project: "my-todo-project",
  keyfile: "/path/to/keyfile.json"
)

task = datastore.find "Task", "sampleTask"
task.key.namespace #=> "ns~todo-project"

require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new(
  project: "my-todo-project",
  keyfile: "/path/to/keyfile.json"
)

task = datastore.find "Task", "sampleTask"
task.key.namespace #=> "ns~todo-project"

params.name: kind
params.description: The kind of the Key. This is optional.

params.name: id_or_name
params.description:
The id or name of the Key. This is
optional.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

parent_key = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Key.new "TaskList", "default"
task_key = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Key.new "Task", "sampleTask"
task_key.parent = parent_key

examples.caption: With multiple levels:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

user_key = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Key.new "User", "alice"
list_key = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Key.new "TaskList", "default"
task_key = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Key.new "Task", "sampleTask"
list_key.parent = user_key
task_key.parent = list_key

require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task_list = datastore.find "TaskList", "default"
query = datastore.query("Task").
  ancestor(task_list)
lists = datastore.run query
lists.first.key.parent # Key("TaskList", "default")

methods.name: path
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Key#path
methods.description: Represent the Key’s path (including parent) as an array of arrays. Each inner array contains two values, the kind and the id or name. If neither an id or name exist then nil will be returned.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

parent_key = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Key.new "TaskList", "default"
task_key = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Key.new "Task", "sampleTask"
task_key.parent = parent_key
task_key.path #=> [["TaskList", "default"], ["Task", "sampleTask"]]

methods.name: complete?
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Key#complete?
methods.description:
Determine if the key is complete. A complete key has either an id or a name.

Inverse of #incomplete?

methods.name: incomplete?
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Key#incomplete?
methods.description:
Determine if the key is incomplete. An incomplete key has neither an id nor a name.

Inverse of #complete?

methods.name: serialized_size
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Key#serialized_size
methods.description: The number of bytes the Key will take to serialize during API calls.
